msItem.note: The following fables are included: Fab. 1 (first half), inc. Ἀετὸς καὶ ἀλώπηξ, expl. θυόντων δὲ τινῶν. Vita W, 93–100, inc. ὅμως συνεῖδον, expl. ἀναγινωσκομένους κατελείπετο. Fab. 1 (second half), inc. ἀετὸς καταπτάς, expl. τιμωρίαν οὐ διαφεύξονται. Fab. (Hausrath and Hunger) 2–4; 9–10; 16–20; 22–23; 27; 284; 283; (Perry) 275; (Hausrath and Hunger) 42; 29; 24; 11; 21; 28; 12–13; 44; 43; 45; 47; 49–50; 60; 57; 52–53; 58; 64; 66–67; 69; 239; 270; 184; 81; 76; 208; 100; 103; 289; 285; 115; A1; 116–117; 120; 126; 288; 146–147. The last fable (inc. λέων γηράσας) is truncated.

bibl.title: Aesopus. Corpus fabularum Aesopicarum
Aesopica: A Series of Texts Relating to Aesop or Ascribed to Him

support.p: Written on Western paper. Watermark oxhead with crown, identical to Harlfinger Boeuf 51, left and right (1481, scribe Antonios Damilas), is present in several units (U2, U8–12 and U14–15); scissors similar to Harlfinger Ciseaux 68(1473–1474) appears in units U3–6. Occasional instances of balance similar to Harlfinger Balance 41 (1488, scribe Theodoros) and anchor remotely similar to Briquet Ancre 460 (1475–1490); partially preserved watermarks include a hat (only the cord and tassel remains), the spikes of a crown, and thongs of a star.

foliation.p: Foliation in Roman numerals in pencil, I-III(pinakes), foliation in ink in the top right corner of every recto page, by the hand of Nicholas de la Torre, 1-336. Inconsistencies: f. 12 is followed by ff. 12a and 12b; f. 34 is followed by f. 34a, thus bringing the total number of leaves up to 342 folios.

p.formula: (II - 1)III (first leaf cut out) ; III6 + (V - 2)12b (the last two leaves were lost [text lacuna] and the first two leaves of the quinion have then, by mistake, been put at the end of the quire) + 8IV75 (folio 34 numbered twice) + IV83 + II87 ; 2IV103 ; 3IV127 ; 3IV151 ; 6IV199 ; IV207 ; 2IV223 ; III229 + IV237 ; 2IV253 ; IV261 ; 3IV285 ; 2IV301 ; (IV - 2)307 (the sixth and seventh leaves cut out) ; 2IV323 ; IV331 ; (III - 1)336 (last leaf cut out).

condition.p: Moderate damage due to moisture and wear. Traces of singeing seen at the edges of some units. The last quire shows severe damage due to burn and water.

layout.p:
Written surface
103/108 x 60/75 on
ff. 1–87, 200–323, 332–336 (U2, U7–15, U17); written surface
95 x 60/65 on and ff. 88–199 and 324–331 (U3–6, U16). Written in one column throughout; mainly between 17 and 20 lines per page. On ff. 332r–336v there are between 42 and 49 lines per page.

handNote.p: One main scribe, Theodoros. His hand is known from two other MSS: Codex Parisinus 3045, where his name is attested in a colophon, and Codex Sinaiticus 1677.
The first unit (U1), ff. I–III is written by a later hand: Nicholas de la Torre added the pinakes and also the folio numbering and a couple of headings.

handDesc.handNote: Two more scribes seem to have been active on just a few pages, one of them in Greek on ff. 104r, 107r, 109r, and 112r (U4), and the other in Latin on ff. 308–323 (U15).

binding.p: [One or more paragraphs describing the binding]

bibl.title: Catalogus centuriae librorum rarissimorum manuscript. & partim impressorum, arabicorum, persicorum, turcicorum, graecorum, latinorum, &c. qua anno MDCCV Bibliothecam Publicam Academiae Upsalensis auxit & exornavit vir illustris & generosissimus Ioan. Gabr. Sparvenfeldius.
Notices Sommaires des Manuscrits grecs de Suède
De codicibus graecis Upsaliensibus olim Escurialensibus
Erytheia
Containing multitudes: Codex Upsaliensis Graecus 8 in perspective
